content: I'm interested in learning more about the intersection of politics and economics, especially in the context of the current state of the economy. I recall reading an article by Paul Krugman from early April that really resonated with me, where he argued that the current state of the economy is not as rosy as the administration claims. Do you think there are any books that might interest me on this topic, perhaps something that explores the relationship between politics, economics, and inequality?
